text: Gerald Roscoe "Jerry" Wilson (December 9, 1936 – March 5, 2015) was a professional American football defensive end with the Philadelphia Eagles (1959–1960) and the San Francisco 49ers (1960) of the National Football League. He also played for the Toronto Argonauts (1962–1964).1962 Toronto Argonauts Wilson played college football at Auburn University, helping them win an NCAA national championship.Defense, lobbying helped 1957 Auburn team to Tigers only national title He graduated from Phillips High in Birmingham, Alabama. ==NFL career== Wilson was drafted by the Chicago Cardinals in 1959. Before entering a regular season game, he was traded to the Philadelphia Eagles on September 4, 1959, for Jerry Norton. Included in the deal to the Eagles was Bob Konovsky. Midway through the 1960 season, Wilson was traded to the San Francisco 49ers. ==Post-NFL== In 1961, Wilson was called to active duty for overseas duty in the Air National Guard. He returned in 1962 to play two years with the Toronto Argonauts of the Canadian Football League.ASHOF Class of 2008: Jerry Wilson ==References== ==External links== * Just Sports Stats * Obituary Category:1936 births Category:2015 deaths Category:American football defensive ends Category:Canadian football defensive linemen Category:American players of Canadian football Category:Players of American football from Alabama Category:Sportspeople from Birmingham, Alabama Category:Auburn Tigers football players Category:Philadelphia Eagles players Category:San Francisco 49ers players Category:Toronto Argonauts players Category:Alabama National Guard personnel
title: Jerry Wilson (defensive end)
